str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb. Diminutive from aren; a lambkin.
A primary preposition and adverb; properly, up; but used severally, or at.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To shepherd, tend, herd; hence: I rule, govern. From poimen; to tend as a shepherd of.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lead, guide; met: I instruct, teach. From hodegos; to show the way (teach).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A fountain, spring, well, issue, flow. Probably from pegnumi; a fount, i.e. Source or supply.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To plaster, wash over; I wipe off, wipe out, obliterate. From ek and aleipho; to smear out, i.e. Obliterate.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A tear. Or dakruon dak'-roo-on; of uncertain affinity; a tear.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
